alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Goodhue; Rice; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:32AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dakota, northern Goodhue, east central Rice, southeastern Washington and western Pierce Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 831 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Farmington to Stanton to near Kenyon. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters have reported pea size hail and frequent lightning with this line. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rosemount and Cannon Falls around 840 AM CDT. Cottage Grove, Hastings and Welch around 850 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Red Wing, Prescott and Bay City. This includes U.S. Highway 61 between mile markers 84 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
